intro: Rhysolepis brittonii, commonly known as the Britton's rhyolepis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spiny fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
